metadata.title: CVE-2018-13982 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Smarty_Security::isTrustedResourceDir() in Smarty before 3.1.33 is prone to a path traversal vulnerability due to insufficient template code sanitization. This allows attackers controlling the executed template code to bypass the trusted directory security restriction and read arbitrary files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-13982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1').
